Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; lotus in added white outline with added red centres above two faded white bands; exterior: worn traces of dots or the like at rim; below, maeander band between pairs of bands; below, part of large maeander square.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1924,1201.333. The metopal decoration in the form of the large maeander is typical of the Wild Goat Style. However, the presence of interior decoration, which is not found on Wild Goat Style vases, suggests that the sherd is possibly late in that style and marks the transition to the Mature Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 261, no. 526)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0385) (phase 2)
